Master Answer:
Women should avoid becoming pregnant for 1 month after getting the chickenpox vaccine.  This applies to any dose of the vaccine.
If you have further questions regarding this, we recommend that you speak with your health care provider. 
For more information about the chickenpox vaccine, see the HealthLinkBC File: Chickenpox Vaccine.
Master Question: Chicken pox vaccine says not to get pregnant for 30 days after vaccine, is this 30 days after first vaccine or 30 days after booster 4 weeks later?
Master Question variation 1: chicken pox vaccine is not to get pregnant after vaccination
Master Question variation 2: how long can you be pregnant chicken pox vaccine
